str2: According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From katanusso; a prickling, i.e. (perhaps by some confusion with neuo or even with nux) stupor.
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.
(a) the ear, (b) met: the faculty of perception. Apparently a primary word; the ear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.
Today, now. Neuter of a presumed compound of the article ho and hemera; on the day; generally, now.
